set.name: Vans Checkerboard Slip-On
set.description:
Back when Vans were cotton canvas blanks, countless kids doodled checkers onto their shoes. That’s how the [Checkerboard Slip-On](https://www.vans.com/shop/checkerboard-slip-on) was born. Now through the Better Cotton Initiative (BCI), your purchase of these iconic Vans supports more sustainable cotton production. Waste is minimized throughout the supply chain, especially during rubber manufacturing. Even the packaging helps, made of recycled and FSC-certified materials. Click around the map to learn more!


DATA AS OF JULY 2018

FEATURES
Click the icons below to reveal unique features of our supply chain. Each element will highlight the facilities whose practices fall under one of the designated categories:

things.name: Vans SFS DC
things.address: 15700 Shoemaker Ave, Santa Fe Springs, CA 90670
things.description:
"Number of Operators: 280
Total Number of Employees: 380
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): 53% Male, 47% Female
Certifications: N/A
Brands Handled: Vans

The Vans distribution center and corporate office relocated to Santa Fe Springs in 1996. In 2007, the Vans corporate office relocated again to Cypress, CA. In 2009, Vans assumed 100% of the space in two buildings, where all footwear, apparel and accessories for Vans in the United States is currently processed for wholesale, retail and eCommerce. This facility handles 17.2M units of footwear annually.

things.name: Great Eastern Resins Industrial Co., Ltd.
things.address: No. 35, 34th Road, Industrial Park, Taichung City 40768, Taiwan
things.description:
Number of Operators: 98
Total Number of Employees: 173
Gender Mix (male-to-female ratio): 88% Male, 12% Female
Certifications: ISO 9001; ISO 14001; OHSAS 18001
Produced Here: Adhesive

Great Eastern Resins Industrial Co., Ltd. installed a water recycling system to collect rainwater for reuse in its lavatories and garden. The water vapor is also collected and reused during product manufacturing to improve water efficiency. This factory has reduced VOC emissions by using a regenerative thermal oxidizer, which treats the VOCs through a bio-filter before they are discharged. The acetone used during the production of the water-based PU adhesive is also recycled through a distillation system.
